body_html:
I also tried this on Ubuntu 14.04 and CUDA 7.5 (thus GPU)
(There is no release pip wheel for TensorFlow with CUDA 8 yet, hopefully it will be out soon - we intend 0.11rc1 to support CUDA 8, so I tried CUDA 7.5. And there are no nvidia/cuda docker images for CUDA 7.5 on Ubuntu 16.04, so I ended up with 14.04)

Here's what I did:

nvidia-docker run -it nvidia/cuda:7.5-cudnn5-devel
apt-get update
apt-get install -y python3 python3-dev python3-pandas python3-pip wget
pip3 install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl
mkdir /tmp/boston
cd /tmp/boston
# Download the files
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_train.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_test.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_predict.csv
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r0.11/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/input_fn/boston.py
python3 boston.py

The fact that this works, suggests that it isn't a GPU problem per se.
To summarize, we found that:

  • CPU/Ubuntu16.04: Works
  • GPU/Ubuntu14.04/CUDA7.5: Works

But we're seeing that whatever your setup (using anaconda) with Ubuntu16.04, CUDA8, Python 3.5 doesn't seem to work? It could be that specific combination, but I'd be surprised.

Could you provide details on how you setup your environment?

body:
I also tried this on Ubuntu 14.04 and CUDA 7.5 (thus GPU)
(There is no release pip wheel for TensorFlow with CUDA 8 yet, hopefully it will be out soon - we intend 0.11rc1 to support CUDA 8, so I tried CUDA 7.5. And there are no nvidia/cuda docker images for CUDA 7.5 on Ubuntu 16.04, so I ended up with 14.04)

Here's what I did:

```
nvidia-docker run -it nvidia/cuda:7.5-cudnn5-devel
apt-get update
apt-get install -y python3 python3-dev python3-pandas python3-pip wget
pip3 install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_x86_64.whl
mkdir /tmp/boston
cd /tmp/boston
# Download the files
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_train.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_test.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_predict.csv
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r0.11/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/input_fn/boston.py
python3 boston.py
```

The fact that this works, suggests that it isn't a GPU problem per se.
To summarize, we found that:
- CPU/Ubuntu16.04: Works
- GPU/Ubuntu14.04/CUDA7.5: Works

But we're seeing that whatever your setup (using anaconda) with Ubuntu16.04, CUDA8, Python 3.5 doesn't seem to work? It could be that specific combination, but I'd be surprised.

Could you provide details on how you setup your environment?
